intro: Forexeta nepalensis, commonly known as the Nepal forexeta, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Nepal and northern India. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, peppery scent. Forexeta nepalensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental and potential medicinal properties.
